TopicTitle: Another Apollo Painting I Whipped Up *UPDATE*

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone, to those who remember my previous post, you know I like to do a lot of space-themed artwork, especially with the Apollo program. Well, here's another one for that area. Check it out, please! I hope you'll enjoy it.

Click the Pic!

If you haven't seen my other post, here's a direct link.

Edited September 10, 2013 by BlueFalcon77
nice! if only the actual Saturn V had rainbow exhaust

Well, I was trying to signify the intensity of the burn. I know the flame burned an intense orange, but I wanted to add in some reds, blues and purples. The darker areas are layer masked, or erased a little bit.

Very nice.

The rainbow colors could be seen from a particular vantage point. After all, those are droplets of water. Unfortunatelly, no one ever saw them.

Very nice work|!

Thank you very much. I enjoyed working on this.

How long did it take to make this?

I mean, it is beautiful. Can you make a Apollo 10 Earth Photo 1080x1920?

How long did it take to make this?

I mean, it is beautiful. Can you make a Apollo 10 Earth Photo 1080x1920?

It took me a few hours to put it all together, then a couple hours of touch-ups, both major and minor. I think I could do Bill Anders' famed Earthrise shot, complete with the camera markers, even. The moon would definitely be a challenge, but since I have a new Intuos tablet, it shouldn't be much of an issue.

EDIT: But please understand that I have college going on; so I will do this, come some free time in the future. Oh, and sorry to correct you, but it's Apollo 8 that got the Earthrise shot.

Edited September 3, 2013 by BlueFalcon77
Oh it's ok. I mean, it is still hard work. And collage and all of that is tough too.

Oh it's ok. I mean, it is still hard work. And collage and all of that is tough too.

Hey, it's fine. It's not like I'm taking 7 classes or anything. I take 3 per semester to avoid overloading. Just going at my own pace. I'd be more than happy to paint the Earthrise.

Oh it's ok. I mean, it is still hard work. And collage and all of that is tough too.

YGS anyone?
